class.name: Bard
class.desc: music, words and dance are magical for you
class.hitpoint_per_level: d8 + CON modifier or 5 + CON modifier

features.name: Bardic Inspiration
features.desc: Your words, musical pieces or dances are filled with so much talent, you can inspire others with it. It's a supernatural talent and your inspiration is represented by your bardic die

feature_data.name: Using bardic inspiration
feature_data.desc: You can take a bonus action to inspire anothe creature within a range of 60ft of you if they can see or hear you. This creature will receive one of your bardic dice, of which they can only have one at a time. When the inspired creature fails a d20 test within the next hour, they can roll the bardic dice and add the rolled value to their d20. the creature can do this once.

feature_data.name: Number of uses
feature_data.desc: You can use Bardic inspiration as many times as your CHA modifier and regain expended uses after a long rest.

feature_data.name: Higher levels
feature_data.desc: Your bardic die upgrades to a d8 at level 5, d10 at level 10 and a d12 at level 15

features.name: Spellcasting
features.desc: You know how to cast spells with your words, music or dances. You can use spells on the bard spell list

feature_data.name: Cantrips
feature_data.desc: You learn 2 cantrips of your choice from the bard spell list. This choice can be changed whenever you gain a character level.

feature_data.name: Spell slots
feature_data.desc: You have limited amounts of spell slots. See your bard's level class features to see how many you're allowed to have

feature_data.name: Prepared spells
feature_data.desc: You prepare a list of spells available to you. See your bard's level class features to see how many you're allowed to have prepared

feature_data.name: Replacing prepared spells
feature_data.desc: When your character level increases, you can change one spell of your spell list with another one with the correct spell slot

feature_data.name: Spellcasting ability
feature_data.desc: You use CHA as your spellcasting ability

feature_data.name: Spellcasting focus
feature_data.desc: you can use a musical instrument for spellcasting

features.name: Expertise
features.desc: You gain expertise in two of your skill proficiencies, which means you can double your proficiency bonus on checks for those skills

features.name: Jack of all trades
features.desc: You can add half your proficiency bonus to any ability checks that doesn't use your proficiency bonus

features.name: Bard Subclass
features.desc: Gain a subclass for your bard character

features.name: Ability score improvement
features.desc: Improve your Ability Score or choose another feat you qualify for

features.name: Font of Inspiration
features.desc: You regain all your expended uses of bardic inspiration by doing a short rest or a long rest

features.name: Subclass feature
features.desc: You gain a feature of your subclass

features.name: Countercharm
features.desc: you can disrupt mind-influencing effects with your music. if you or a creature within the range of 30ft of you fails a saving throw against being charmed or frightened, you can use a reaction to cause a reroll with advantage

features.name: Superior Inspiration
features.desc: When rolling for initiative, you get back your expended bardic inspiration uses until you have 2.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.desc: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat you qualify for.

features.name: Words of creation
features.desc: You always have the Power Word Heal and Power Word Kill spells prepared. When casting it on one creature, you can cast it on a second creature if it's within 10ft of the first target

subclasses.name: College of Glamour
subclasses.desc: You weave threads of beauty and terror in your songs and stories

features.name: Beguiling magic
features.desc: You always have Charm Person and Mirror Image prepared. you can also force another creature within the range of 60ft to make a WIS saving throw against your spell save DC when casting an enchantment or illusion spell using a spell slot. If they fail, they will be charmed or frightened for a minute

features.name: Mantle of Inspiration
features.desc: You weave fey magic into your song or dance. You can take a bonus action to expend a bardic inspiration and roll a bardic inspiration die. The doubled die value will be the amount of temporary hit points you can give to creatures within 60 ft of you (the amount of creatures is equal to your CHA modifier and they all receive the doubled value of the die). All affected creatures can then take a reaction as well to move up to their regular speed without causing opportunity attacks

features.name: Mantle of Majesty
features.desc: You always have the Command spell prepared, which you can cast without expending a spell slot using a bonus action. You take the appearance of something not from this planet for 1 minute or until your concentration ends. While in this form you can cast command as a bonus action. Any creature you charmed automatically fails their saving throw against your command spell. Use this once per long rest or use a level 3+ spell slot to use it again (no action required).

features.name: Unbreakable Majesty
features.desc: Using a bonus action you can become a majestic magical being for a minute or until you are incapacitated. during this time creatures attacking you must succeed on a CHA saving throw against your spell save DC or else they miss.

subclasses.name: College of Dance
subclasses.desc: You are in harmony with the cosmos that emphasizes agility speed and grace

features.name: Dazzling footwork
features.desc: while unarmored or unshielded, you gain the following benefits:

feature_data.name: Dance virtuoso
feature_data.desc: You can roll with advantage on any CHA checks that involve dancing

feature_data.name: Unarmored defense
feature_data.desc: Your base AC equals 10 + DEX modifier + CHA modifier

feature_data.name: Agile strikes
feature_data.desc: When a bardic inspiration is expended using a normal action, bonus action or a reaction, you can make an unarmed strike as part of that action

feature_data.name: Bardic damage
feature_data.desc: You can use DEX instead of STR for attack rolls of unarmed strikes. the bludgening damage is equal to your bardic inspiration die + DEX modifier and doesn't expend a die

features.name: Inspiring movement
features.desc: If an enemy ends its turn within 5ft of you, you (and an ally of choice within 30ft) can use a reaction and expend one of your bardic inspiration to move up to half your speed without causing opportunity attacks

features.name: Tandem footwork
features.desc: when rolling for initiative you can use a bardic inspiration to give every ally within 30ft a bonus equal to the rolled dice value on their initiative

features.name: Leading evasion
features.desc: When an effect allows you to make a DEX saving throw to half the damage, you take no damage on succes and only half damage on fail. creatures making the same DEX save within 5ft of you share this benefit.

subclasses.name: College of Lore
subclasses.desc: You collect spells and secrets from various sources from libraries

features.name: Bonus proficiencies
features.desc: you have 3 extra proficiecies for skills of your choice

features.name: Cutting words
features.desc: If a creature within 60ft of range of you that you can see makes a damage roll or succeeds an ability check/attack roll, you can use a reaction to expend one of your bardic dice and substract the rolled value off the rolled value of the target

features.name: Magical discoveries
features.desc: Learn 2 spells of your choice. these spells can come from the Cleric, Druid or wizard spell list. this must be a cantrip or a spell of which you have spellslots available. These spells are always prepared and when you gain a bard level you can change one of the spells.

features.name: Peerless skill
features.desc: When you fail an ability check or attack roll you can expend one bardic inspiration and use the rolled die as a bonus on your d20 value

features.name: Combat inspiration
features.desc: you can turn the tide of the battle, as a creature that has a bardic inspiration of yours can use it for the following benefits:

feature_data.name: Defense
feature_data.desc: When hit by an attack roll the creature may use a reaction to roll the die and add the rolled value to their AC for that attack

feature_data.name: offense
feature_data.desc: When the creature hits a target with their attack roll, they can roll the bardic die and add the rolled value to the damage of the attack

features.name: Martial training
features.desc: You are proficient with martial weapons and training with medium armor and shields and use the martial weapons as spellcasting focus

features.name: Extra attack
features.desc: you can attack twice on your turn. one of the two attacks can be a cantrip with a casting time of 1 action.

features.name: Battle magic
features.desc: after casting a spell with a casting time of 1 action, you can use a bonus action to make an attack with a weapon
